text:
Question 74) The word “biotechnology” arose in the twentieth century, when scientist Herbert Boyer introduced the information responsible for the manufacture of human insulin into a bacteria so that it would produce substance.
Bacteria modified by Herbert Boyer began to produce human insulin because they received
A) The sequence of human insulin coding DNA.
B) protein synthesized by human cells.
C) a recombinant RNA of human insulin.
D) The messenger RNA of human insulin.
E) a chromosome of the human species.
